alert.note: Alert for Fremont; Natrona (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 29 at 6:58PM MDT until June 29 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected, especially for Badwater, Snyder, Clear, and Alkali Creeks. * WHERE...A portion of central Wyoming, including the following counties, Fremont and Natrona. * WHEN...Until 1145 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Rises and flooding along small streams and normally dry washes. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 654 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This is likely to cause small stream flooding, especially for Badwater, Snyder, Clear, and Alkali Creeks. Between 1.25 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen, and heavy rain continues in the area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Cottonwood Creek, Red Creek, Sioux Creek, South Fork Badwater Creek, Snyder Creek, Dry Fork Badwater Creek, Bridger Creek, Clear Creek, South Fork Sand Creek, Badwater Creek, Sand Creek, Cedar Gap Draw and Alkali Creek. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Lysite and Lost Cabin.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Washes, streams, and rivers can become raging currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
